intro: Navarretia minima var. suksdorfii, commonly known as the Suksdorf's narrowleaf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. It is an annual or biennial species that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its delicate appearance and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
